unit.utterance: istoria na ay taga-Danak a gilangan,
unit.utterance_translation: Here is the (his) story, (of) a Danak man,
(the name is) Udulan.
He shot his arrow,
(which) went to Sabing.
It went to an unmarried woman.
from Sabing.

unit.utterance: ay pangal ni Udulani a atti: ta Danak.
unit.utterance_translation: It is Udulan's arrow that was in Danak.

unit.utterance: Aytay, nabayag a o:ras aydi bulan,
unit.utterance_translation: Now, after a long time of some months,

unit.utterance: Nanga:na:di gilangani. Ay atti:tep ta. Ay buka:gan, nanga:na:di.
unit.utterance_translation: a man came to have a child, though he was still there. A woman gave birth.
A woman gave birth in Sabing.

unit.utterance: Atti:tep i gilangani ta ayta Danak.
unit.utterance_translation: The man was still there in Danak.
She gave birth. Her baby was male.

unit.utterance: Aytay, numangaydi. Nangayan a nalap i pangal ni gilangani.
unit.utterance_translation: Then (she) went out. She went out and got the man's arrow.
She showed it to the Arta people.
"Who shot here?" [said the woman]
"I did not shoot." [said a member of the community]
They talked like that.
Finally, she arrived in Danak
"That's my arrow [i.e. I shot it]", said this guy.
"(Your) wife gave birth to a child. Your wife is there in Sabing."

unit.utterance: Punanna ayni babakati, a ina ni buka:gani.
unit.utterance_translation: Said an elderly woman, the mother of the woman.
They (both the man and the woman) went there
there to Sabing.

unit.utterance: Nebbu:lunde:tid a numangay ta Danak aytidi nampakatde:tid.
unit.utterance_translation: Being together, Those who got married went to Danak.
because they have one child.
This man was Udulang.
He shot his arrow.

unit.utterance: Saddya i nanga:na:di buka:gani ta gilangan.
unit.utterance_translation: That is why the woman, with the man, had a child.
They arrived at their house.
It is the end. No more.
"Isanuwa:t√®n"
Here is a story of my father's.
As for Isanuwa:t√®n
He went (to a place) downstream.
He saw the woman.
He came with/bring the thing like this. [i.e. a necklace, as indicated in his gesture]
He gave it to the woman.

unit.utterance: Nangat√®dman ni buka:gani ta man ni nyat√®dnad.
unit.utterance_translation: The woman gave him a thing like what he gave to her.
She gave it to the man in return.
The man had a child.

unit.utterance: Matagi:te:taw ti: da numangayt√®n ta mambira ta laman a pangkasaranta.
unit.utterance_translation: "Just wait (for a while) because I will go to find wild pigs to hold a wedding ceremony."
"Yes", said the woman.
The man stayed in the upstream for a long time.
The man did not come back.
So the woman got married to another man.
(But finally) Isanuwa:t√®n came back to the woman.
What did he see? There was a husband of hers.
Bring my necklace to me.

unit.utterance: da nangasawadmande:taw ta si:pang a gilangan.
unit.utterance_translation: because you married another man.
Bring it here!

unit.utterance: Nyat√®dna, awande:ta yatadna da atti:di nangasawad.
unit.utterance_translation: He gave (it) (to her), there is nothing to give (back to him), because there is already one who (she) married.
Sanuwa:t√®n got angry.
He killed the woman.
because she married another man.

unit.utterance: Wa:y numangayde:tid ta diddya. Numangayde:ti sanuwat√®n ta diddya.
unit.utterance_translation: They went far upstream. Sanuwat√®ng went upstream.

unit.utterance: Nasagbitna i buka:gani aydi gilangani aydi nasagbittep i sanuwa:t√®n.
unit.utterance_translation: He stabbed the woman and the man (her husband), and he also stabbed Sanuwat√®n.
But he went upstream.

unit.utterance: Awanmi tataw amma nappati ti Sanuwa:t√®n da a:yi matl√®mnay a mange:be:butdi ti naddima ni ayti mangikkaragatan a sinagbiddi.
unit.utterance_translation: We do not know if Satuwat√®ng died or not because there was blood along the pathway, which ran by being stabbed with a stone blade.

unit.utterance: Ayta, binagayday didi ama ni buka:gan a nappati aydi gila:ngani.
unit.utterance_translation: The fathers of the woman and her husband chased in line.

unit.utterance: Awandi di:ta ti Sanuwa:t√®n sinumu:lidtid. Saddya kigad na awandi.
unit.utterance_translation: But there was no Sanuwat√®n anymore. So they returned. That is the end. No more.
